comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I do not think that the word "swap*" is correct, and therefore you need to either use CEXs where you will deposit cardano (ADA) and then decide to withdraw Tether (USD T) on TRON, ETH, plogon or any blockchain, or DEXs, but with higher fees and the same amount of centralization.There are two good options if you don't want to verify your KYC which are OKX[1] and kucoin[2].And you can click on the link in my signature to search for multiple options.[1] https://www.okx.com/[2] https://www.kucoin.com/* QuoteSwap allows users to easily exchange one cryptocurrency for another without leaving their Blockchain

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: If you fine with KYC, I can suggest to use Kraken since this exchange offer very low fee and the exchange is reputable enough [1] I don't think they will scam, even though this exchange have few accusations in the past.Quote from: hugeblack on April 19, 2023, 12:16:47 PMI do not think that the word "swap*" is correctThere are two good options if you don't want to verify your KYC which are OKX[1] and kucoin[2].Yeah, Cardano is mainly run in BSC chain while USDT is mainly run in ETH chain.Keep note @OP, you shouldn't expect the exchange will never ask your KYC especially if you trade with huge amount of money.[1] https://support.kraken.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000767986-Cryptocurrency-withdrawal-fees-and-minimums

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Apocollapse on April 19, 2023, 12:36:47 PMYeah, Cardano is mainly run in BSC chain while USDT is mainly run in ETH chain.AFAIK, Cardano is blockchain not a token, and they have coin which is ADA, thus, they cannot work on another blockchain, if they exist in another blockchain, they are useless wrapped token[1] run on BSC.USDT is token thus, it can be founded in several blockchains, most in TRON, although some prefer it on polygon due to the cheap fees.It is rarely found in ETH blockchain.[1] https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-are-wrapped-tokens/

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: FUCKBSVFUCK on May 10, 2023, 09:19:59 AMI don't know if you can use this method to convert Tether to USDT, but it's notrecommended. You can use a coinbase wallet, which is a good alternative.What are you trying to say here? The "wallet" is not supposed to exchange between cryptocurrencies without the need for a third party, and therefore you do the transfer using the interface of that wallet and third party (CEXs or DEXs) works in the background.So coinbase wallet can not convert cardano (ADA) into Tether (USD T) but coinbase exchange can.

comments.author: Jackl87
comments.body: Quote from: fred1234567 on April 19, 2023, 10:38:17 AMPlease advise best way (tutorial) how to swap Cardano into Tether.what is the most advantageous way to arrange the swap,rates?thanks for the helpAs others in this thread have already mentioned, there are many different ways to trade your Cardano for USDT. You can use a decentralized exchange that is running on the Cardano chain but i don't know how big the liquidity is for such a trading pair on the Dexes. Also you would get Cardano USDT then and you probably would like to have those USDT on the Ethereum or BSC chain i would assume.Therefore i would say that the easiest and safest way to get those USDT would be to send your Cardano to a CEX like Binance, Kucoin, Kraken or whatever and then simply trade it for USDT there. Maybe you have to register and do a KYC first if you have not used Cexes before, but that takes not that long.
